001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.initializers;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.Neuron;
005
006import java.util.Random;
007
008/**
009 * He (Kaiming) weight initializer.
010 * <p>
011 * Initializes weights with values drawn from a Normal distribution
012 * with mean 0 and variance 2/fanIn, where fanIn is the number of
013 * input connections to the neuron. This works well with ReLU activations.
014 * <p>
015 * The bias is left unchanged (as is common practice).
016 */
017@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
018public class HeInitializer implements NeuralNetworkInitializer {
019
020    private final Random random = new Random();
021
022    /**
023     * {@inheritDoc}
024     */
025    @Override
026    public void initialize(Neuron neuron) {
027        float[] weights = neuron.getWeights();
028        int fanIn = weights.length;
029        double std = Math.sqrt(2.0 / fanIn);
030
031        for (int i = 0; i < weights.length; i++) {
032            // Gaussian(0, std^2)
033            weights[i] = (float) (random.nextGaussian() * std);
034        }
035        // Bias left unchanged
036    }
037}
